thread.title: Local duo Rain and Leaves to hold CD release party
thread.title_full: Local duo Rain and Leaves to hold CD release party

author: Missy Rosenberry - Webster, Rochester
title: Local duo Rain and Leaves to hold CD release party
text:
I consider myself very fortunate to know so many musicians on the Webster music scene. Chances are, if there's a band playing at Barry's or Hatter's or Rubino's, I know them. And I'm pleased to call most of them very good friends. Just recently I learned about a relatively new band, called Rain & Leaves. Its members, Josh Falling and Cassie Roberts, are Webster folk. They're friends of some friends, so I don't know them very well yet. But I expect that to change very soon, because I do love their music and will be making an effort to catch their shows when they play at Barry's. Or Hatter's. Or Rubino's. Or anywhere else.
Josh and Cassie have released a new EP, which they'll officially introduce at a CD release party on Friday October 16 at the Harmony House, 58 East Main Street in Webster.
The CD, titled Buttons EP , includes six original tunes: "Next," "Stop," "Rewind," "Play," "Fast Forward," and "Record," featuring Cassie on bass and vocals, and Josh on electric guitar, acoustic guitar, ukulele, synth, drums and vocals. Together they create a sound which they describe as "electropop original," interspersed with an entertaining assortment of popular and alternative covers.
In addition to music from Rain & Leaves, the concert will feature appearances by Barry's Crossing , Seek No Bounds and Gregg Albertson .
Admission is $6, which includes a copy of Buttons EP, or $3 without the CD. Tickets will be available at the door and through the Rain & Leaves Facebook page . the concert begins at 7 pm, and doors will open at 6:30.
For more information about Rain & Leaves, and to purchase a copy of their new Buttons EP , log onto their website at www.rainandleaves.com , or their Facebook page at www. facebook.com/rainandleaves .
Cassie Roberts and Josh Falling are the duo Rain & Leaves (provided photo)
